content:
I apologize for the error. Let me correct the code to properly handle entity removal:

```python
# Clean up extra entities
entities = get_entities({Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, Prototype.IronChest, Prototype.BurnerInserter})
for entity in entities:
    pickup_entity(entity, entity.position)  # Pass the entity object directly, not its name

# Start fresh with a new setup
# 1. Place drill on iron ore patch
iron_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_pos)
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, position=iron_pos, direction=Direction.DOWN)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=10)

print(f"\nDrill placed at {drill.position} with drop at {drill.drop_position}")

# 2. Place furnace 2 tiles below drill
furnace_pos = Position(x=drill.position.x, y=drill.position.y + 2)
move_to(furnace_pos)
furnace = place_entity(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=furnace_pos)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=10)

print(f"\nFurnace placed at {furnace.position}")

# 3. Place inserter between them
inserter_pos = Position(x=drill.position.x, y=drill.position.y + 1)
move_to(inserter_pos)
inserter = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, position=inserter_pos)
rotate_entity(inserter, Direction.DOWN)  # Point DOWN to move ore from drill to furnace
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, inserter, quantity=5)

print(f"\nInserter placed:")
print(f"Position: {inserter.position}")
print(f"Pickup: {inserter.pickup_position}")
print(f"Drop: {inserter.drop_position}")

# Verify the setup
print("\nFinal setup verification:")
for entity in get_entities():
    if entity.name in ["burner-mining-drill", "stone-furnace", "burner-inserter"]:
        print(f"\n{entity.name} at {entity.position}:")
        print(f"  Direction: {entity.direction}")
        print(f"  Status: {entity.status}")
        if hasattr(entity, 'drop_position'):
            print(f"  Drop position: {entity.drop_position}")
        if hasattr(entity, 'pickup_position'):
            print(f"  Pickup position: {entity.pickup_position}")
        if hasattr(entity, 'furnace_source'):
            print(f"  Furnace source: {entity.furnace_source}")
        if hasattr(entity, 'furnace_result'):
            print(f"  Furnace result: {entity.furnace_result}")

# Wait a moment to see if it's working
sleep(5)
print(f"\nInventory after waiting: {inspect_inventory()}")
```

The key changes are:
1. Fixed the `pickup_entity()` call to pass the entity object directly instead of the entity name
2. Kept the same logical structure for placing new entities
3. Maintained the verification steps to ensure proper setup

This should now:
1. Successfully clean up existing entities
2. Place a new mining drill on iron ore
3. Place a furnace in the correct position to receive ore
4. Place an inserter to move ore from drill to furnace
5. Add fuel to all machines
6. Verify the setup is working correctly

Let me know if you see any other issues or if you need adjustments to the positioning or setup.
